trial_identification.studytitle: Folate status of women of childbearing age in Dunedin and Wellington, New Zealand
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A cross-sectional survey of women between the ages of 18 and 44 years to determine their serum and red blood cell folate concentrations.

conditions.healthcondition: Consumption of folic acid fortified foods.

interventions.interventions: Fasting serum and red blood cell folate concentrations at one point in time. Frequency of consumption of folic acid fortified foods.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Serum and red blood cell folate concentrations as measured by a microbiological assay.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Frequency of consumption of folic acid fortified foods as assessed by a telephone interview.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Asked at one point in time about the consumption of folic acid fortified foods. This occurs within 2 weeks of the blood test.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Females between the ages of 18 and 44 years.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Department of Human Nutrition University of Otago PO Box 56 Dunedin 9054

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry PO Box 2526 Wellington 6140

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Department of Human Nutrition University of Otago PO Box 56 Dunedin 9054

ethicsAndSummary.summary: In August 2009 the government announced that mandatory fortification of bread with folic acid - due to be implemented in September 2009 - would be delayed until May 2012. In the interim, the bread manufacturers agreed to voluntarily fortify approximately 30% of their breads with folic acid from April 2010. The proposed project is a cross-sectional survey of women of childbearing age from two New Zealand centers - Dunedin and Wellington - to be undertaken in 2011. The purpose of the research is to determine blood folate levels of women following the adoption of the new voluntary fortification programme.
